description: Use of building as Beauty Clinic within existing Use Class E. Internal alterations, installation of new flooring, new internal partitions and dropped ceilings.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

All new external and internal work must match existing original work in terms of choice of materials, method of construction, and finished appearance. This applies unless differences are shown on the drawings we have approved, or are required by conditions of this permission.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior the commencement of any works to the external walls and windows the following details must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing:- Schedule of works, corresponding method statements and material specification- Elevations and plans showing the areas where repair work is neededThe development must only be carried out in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise first agreed in writing.Reason: Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior the commencement of any works to the roof the following details must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing:- Schedule of works and corresponding method statements.- Schedule of works and corresponding method statements.- A schedule identifying the type, size and condition of roof slates and tiles, indicating which are to be re-used and which are - to be replaced; any proposed replacements should match the size and design of the existing 'original' roof slates.- A schedule of the roof level leadwork, showing that which is to be retained and that to be replaced.- Drawings illustrating details of flues, vents or other pipework piercing the roof, including finishes.The development must only be carried out in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise first agreed in writing.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No external lighting, CCTV, security systems, grilles, or other external fixtures or their associated service runs are approved as part of the current application. Prior the commencement of any works the following details must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing: - The submission of a full set of drawings showing any proposed external fixtures and fittings in plan and elevation, including indicative routes for any associated service runs and how these are to be fixed to the building; a corresponding schedule cross-referenced to these drawings; and manufacturer's specification for all proposed fittings.The development must only be carried out in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise first agreed in writing.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the removal of the Timber ladder to the basement and Lifting equipment in Eastern Room on 2nd Floor Level, a report detailing these features and their proposed use, with a set of measured drawings and photographs recording them in situ, must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.These sound features forming part of the building shall be carefully taken down, protected and securely stored for later re-erection/re-use or display.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement, details shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to ensure that precautions are taken to secure and protect the interior and exterior features during the building work; including chimney pieces, plasterwork, architraves, panelling, doors, windows and staircase balustrades. The agreed measures shall be carried out in full. No such features shall be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or without the prior approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement, details of the position, type and method of installation of all new and relocated services and related fixtures (for the avoidance of doubt this includes communications and information technology servicing), shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval, wherever these installations are to be visible, or where ducts or other methods of concealment are proposed. This includes the submission of a full set of drawings showing any proposed external fixtures and fittings in plan and elevation, including indicative routes for any associated service runs; a corresponding schedule cross-referenced to these drawings; and manufacturer's specification for all proposed visible fittings.The development must only be carried out in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise first agreed in writing.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No new plumbing, pipes, soil-stacks, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved, without the prior approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
